creator: kot.pat.dar@gmail.com
text:
I'm having problem with Jmeter when trying to use in beanshell sampler with external Jar which i wrote.
My jar is comparing results (JSON format) from web service with results of MySQL query. In side of jar I am using json-simple-1.1.1 library.

When I'm using jmx file on my computer where i have JDK 1.7.0_60 i have sampler results:

Thread Name: group by sale amount 1-1
Sample Start: 2014-10-15 11:52:29 CEST
Load time: 7
Latency: 0
Size in bytes: 0
Headers size in bytes: 0
Body size in bytes: 0
Sample Count: 1
Error Count: 1
Response code: 500
Response message: org.apache.jorphan.util.JMeterException: Error invoking bsh method: eval	com/*****/***********/jmeter/ComparisonJsonMySql : Unsupported major.minor version 52.0

Response headers:


SampleResult fields:
ContentType: 
DataEncoding: null

But when I used my jmx file on colleagues computer with JDK 1.7.0.45(with windows 7) it worked fine and even it's given proper results.

Most of code in jar was written in beanshell sampler and then changed to jar for better debugging. I have checked on what JDK jmeter is working and what versions have: java and javac. All of them was 1.7.0_60. Jar was compiled with the same JDK.

creator: felix.schumacher@internetallee.de
text:
major.minor version 52.0 indicates, that you compiled your jar with java 8 (or have added components, that were compiled with java 8).

That will not work, when you run that jar with java 7. This has nothing to do with jmeter, really.

creator: kot.pat.dar@gmail.com
text:
It's reasonable explanation, but i did compile it with JDK 7  and my code was working when it was fully coded in beanshell and it's working on other computer.
So its not a problem of Simple.json.1.1.1 lib. and my code is working properly on JDK 1.7.0_46 version. The other thing is that I just copied my jar to other computer with JDK 1.7.0_45 and it worked.
I was searching for reasonable solution, but this problem with major.minor problem isn't so much described. 
Do you have some good solution for it ??

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
You say your code works on JDK7 , are you sure you are using the jar (that you use on jmeter) and run a JAVA 7?

Run 
java -version to check
java -classpath <your jar + dependencies> Class 

YOu will see.
Please switch to User Mailing list, but it is sure it is not a JMETER issue.

Unsupported major.minor version 52.0 means , the class your are etelling me to run has been compiled with JAVA8 compatibility, I don't know how to read it as I am a lower Java.

Regards
